result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Demand For Discovery, Notice of Intent To Use Statements of Defendant and DNA Evidence_1 - Kainz, Justin David.pdf

Issuing Agency: GCSD
Violations: DC, Battery, Bail Jumping MISD
Conditions: No Violent or Abusive contact with T.L.S.

11:05 AM Defendant Justin David Kainz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court for Justin David Kainz with zoom video also.  Attorney Matt Lantta in court for State of Wisconsin. DE requests break out with his Attorney from 11:06 AM  to 11:12 AM. Defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant had time to discuss this matter with this Attorney. Court finds probable cause.  Defendant bound over for trial. Information given to Defense Attorney and filed with The Court.  Court advises defendant of charges & penalties. Defendant waives reading of information. Attorney Murphy was provided with a copy of the complaint and waives formal reading. Not Guilty plea entered on all counts.  Parties request bond modification if this case. The court directs the clerk to prepare a modified bond. Matter set over.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:17 PM Defendant Justin David Kainz appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Matt Lantta appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Murphy was appointed to the DE by the State Public Defenders office. DE states he has had no contact with Attorney Murphy and wishes to have a different Attorney represent him. The court finds good cause to delay preliminary hearing until an Attorney is on board. DE was advised by the court to contact the State Public Defenders office to seek new representation. Date scheduled for status. 2:22 PM Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared by video for Justin David Kainz. 2:30 PM Attorney Murphy returns from breakout room and states he and the DE are able to work together. Matter set over.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
